title: Get up to $170 OFF with the Google Pixel 8!
description: Save big with Google's slightly older flagship phone. The post Get up to $170 OFF with the Google Pixel 8! appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: Save big with Google's slightly older flagship phone.
text: While the Pixel 9 series is finally here, the Google Pixel 8 is still an undoubtedly capable Android phone. With that in mind, folks after a capable smartphone camera can check out the Pixel 8 right now, which is going for as low as $529 on Amazon. In terms of specs, the Pixel 8 comes with some much-welcome upgrades over its predecessor, such as a smoother and brighter display with a 120Hz refresh rate, the same great camera quality, a more capable Tensor G3 chipset, new generative AI features, and a larger battery with faster charging speeds. Google has also included up to seven years of software support, meaning that you can keep holding onto the Pixel 8 for a very long time. You can check it out using the link below. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
While the Pixel 9 series is finally here, the Google Pixel 8 is still an undoubtedly capable Android phone. With that in mind, folks after a capable smartphone camera can check out the Pixel 8 right now, which is going for as low as $529 on Amazon.

In terms of specs, the Pixel 8 comes with some much-welcome upgrades over its predecessor, such as a smoother and brighter display with a 120Hz refresh rate, the same great camera quality, a more capable Tensor G3 chipset, new generative AI features, and a larger battery with faster charging speeds. Google has also included up to seven years of software support, meaning that you can keep holding onto the Pixel 8 for a very long time. You can check it out using the link below.

Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
